This is done by building a [C\\:6\\:0\\:.string: This is done by building a [C:6:0:0]Still[C:7:0:0] from the [C:5:0:1]Build[C:7:0:0] menu using [C:5:0:1]Workshops[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Farming[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Still[C:7:0:0].

Once the [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Still[C\\:7\\:0\.string: Once the [C:6:0:0]Still[C:7:0:0] is constructed, click on it and add the task [C:3:0:1]Brew Drink from Plant (or fruit)[C:7:0:0].  If you have no suitable [C:6:0:1]Plants[C:7:0:0], you

The task also requires a [C\\:6\\:0\\:1].string: The task also requires a [C:6:0:1]Barrel[C:7:0:0] from the [C:6:0:0]Carpenter's Workshop[C:7:0:0].

If you survive until the caravan comes y.string: If you survive until the caravan comes you may also trade for [C:6:0:1]Drinks[C:7:0:0]

or [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Plants[C\\:7\\:0\\:0].string: or [C:6:0:1]Plants[C:7:0:0] there.  The number of [C:6:0:1]Drink[C:7:0:0] rations can be seen at the top of the screen.

Absent alcohol and in warmer weather, yo.string: Absent alcohol and in warmer weather, you can designate a [C:3:0:0]Water Source[C:7:0:0] from the [C:5:0:1]Zones[C:7:0:0] menu at a river or pond,

so that your residents have water to dri.string: so that your residents have water to drink.  You'll want one of these anyway for other purposes, like cleaning

and certain [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Workshop[C\\:.string: and certain [C:6:0:0]Workshop[C:7:0:0] tasks.  You may find water underground.

There's some food on the embark [C\\:6\\.string: There's some food on the embark [C:6:0:0]Wagon[C:7:0:0], and you can trade for food, but you can also grow your own.

The [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Wagon[C\\:7\\:0\\:0].string: The [C:6:0:0]Wagon[C:7:0:0] comes with some [C:6:0:1]Seeds[C:7:0:0], but as you might expect, these crops must be grown underground!

Using [C\\:5\\:0\\:1]Mining[C\\:7\\:0\\:.string: Using [C:5:0:1]Mining[C:7:0:0] orders, you'll need to carve out a rectangular area underground for your [C:6:0:0]Farmplot[C:7:0:0].

The underground rectangle must be near t.string: The underground rectangle must be near the surface, where there is soil (loam, clay, or sand.) One level down should suffice, before you hit rock.

The highest mountain elevations do not h.string: The highest mountain elevations do not have soil.

Make sure to leave the ceiling above int.string: Make sure to leave the ceiling above intact so the underground soil doesn't receive any sunlight.

With a subterranean soil floor exposed,.string: With a subterranean soil floor exposed, you can place an underground [C:6:0:0]Farmplot[C:7:0:0].

This isn't rich soil, but will suffice f.string: This isn't rich soil, but will suffice for now.  Dig deeper to find better soil.

Select [C\\:5\\:0\\:1]Farmplot[C\\:7\\:0.string: Select [C:5:0:1]Farmplot[C:7:0:0] from the [C:5:0:1]Build[C:7:0:0] menu.  It's in [C:5:0:1]Workshops[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Farming[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Farmplot[C:7:0:0].  Place the [C:6:0:0]Farmplot[C:7:0:0] on the subterranean soil.

You need to select the crops to be grown.string: You need to select the crops to be grown each season.

Click on the [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Farmplot[C\\.string: Click on the [C:6:0:0]Farmplot[C:7:0:0] you placed to pull up the [C:5:0:1]Farming[C:7:0:0] menu.

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Plump Helmets[C\\:7\\:0\\.string: [C:6:0:1]Plump Helmets[C:7:0:0] are edible and the default [C:6:0:0]Wagon[C:7:0:0] comes with [C:6:0:1]Plump Helmet Spawn[C:7:0:0], which are their "seeds".

Note that you can obtain aboveground [C\.string: Note that you can obtain aboveground [C:6:0:1]Seeds[C:7:0:0] from trade or by eating gathered [C:6:0:1]Plants[C:7:0:0], but aboveground farming exposes your [C:2:0:0]Planters[C:7:0:0] to dangers and the elements.

Now your [C\\:2\\:0\\:0]Planters[C\\:7\\.string: Now your [C:2:0:0]Planters[C:7:0:0], those that can access both the [C:6:0:0]Farmplot[C:7:0:0] and the [C:6:0:1]Spawn[C:7:0:0], will plant the field, and after a period of growth, they'll be harvested.

If you'd like to focus a few of your cit.string: If you'd like to focus a few of your citizens on farming, which gives skill benefits, you can assign them to the [C:2:0:0]Planters[C:7:0:0] work detail from the [C:5:0:1]Labor[C:7:0:0] menu.

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Fertilizer[C\\:7\\:0\\:0].string: [C:6:0:1]Fertilizer[C:7:0:0] and skilled [C:2:0:0]Planters[C:7:0:0] have a direct impact on crop yield.

These effects are more pronounced deep u.string: These effects are more pronounced deep underground where you can locate the cavern biome and its rich soil.

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Potash[C\\:7\\:0\\:0] is.string: [C:6:0:1]Potash[C:7:0:0] is the fertilizer of choice, and it can be created in the [C:6:0:0]Ashery[C:7:0:0], using [C:6:0:1]Ash[C:7:0:0] from [C:6:0:1]Wood[C:7:0:0] burned in a [C:6:0:0]Wood Furnace[C:7:0:0].  A [C:3:0:0]Water Source[C:7:0:0] zone and a [C:6:0:1]Bucket[C:7:0:0] are also required.

If there is a river or pond nearby you m.string: If there is a river or pond nearby you may consider fishing.  If the water isn't frozen, a worker with the

fishing labor assigned will begin fishin.string: fishing labor assigned will begin fishing automatically.

You can optionally choose to designate a.string: You can optionally choose to designate a [C:3:0:0]Fishing[C:7:0:0] zone if you don't want your workers going far afield.

Remember, your workers do not eat raw fi.string: Remember, your workers do not eat raw fish!  You must build a [C:6:0:0]Fishery[C:7:0:0] to prepare them.

It is possible to survive by gathering p.string: It is possible to survive by gathering plants outside.  Do this by selecting the [C:5:0:1]Gathering[C:7:0:0] order.

Then draw a rectangle over the bushes yo.string: Then draw a rectangle over the bushes you wish to search.

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Meat[C\\:7\\:0\\:0] from.string: [C:6:0:1]Meat[C:7:0:0] from [C:2:0:0]Livestock[C:7:0:0] you slaughter is a source of food.

To slaughter an [C\\:2\\:0\\:0]Animal[C\.string: To slaughter an [C:2:0:0]Animal[C:7:0:0] you must first build a [C:6:0:0]Butcher's Shop[C:7:0:0].

Do this by selecting the building in [C\.string: Do this by selecting the building in [C:5:0:1]Workshops[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Farming[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Butcher[C:7:0:0].

Once the shop is built, open the [C\\:5\.string: Once the shop is built, open the [C:5:0:1]Creatures[C:7:0:0] info menu.  From there select the [C:5:0:1]Pets/Livestock[C:7:0:0] tab.

There you can select which [C\\:2\\:0\\:.string: There you can select which [C:2:0:0]Animals[C:7:0:0] to slaughter.  You may need to minimize the tutorial to see the [C:5:0:1]Slaughter[C:7:0:0] buttons.

Note that some [C\\:2\\:0\\:0]Livestock[.string: Note that some [C:2:0:0]Livestock[C:7:0:0] must eat vegetation to survive.

To keep them alive use the [C\\:3\\:0\\:.string: To keep them alive use the [C:3:0:0]Pen/Pasture[C:7:0:0] zone from the [C:5:0:1]Zones[C:7:0:0] menu to select a section of grass and click the

[C\\:3\\:0\\:0]Zones[C\\:7\\:0\\:0] are.string: [C:3:0:0]Zones[C:7:0:0] are areas you designate where your citizens will work, socialize, rest, or perform specific duties.

There are several kinds of [C\\:3\\:0\\:.string: There are several kinds of [C:3:0:0]Zones[C:7:0:0], which you can see in the panel on the left.

Certain [C\\:3\\:0\\:0]Zones[C\\:7\\:0\\.string: Certain [C:3:0:0]Zones[C:7:0:0] like [C:3:0:0]Bedrooms[C:7:0:0] can be placed several at a time.

Just make sure you have the correct [C\\.string: Just make sure you have the correct [C:6:0:0]Furniture[C:7:0:0] placed in the rooms with [C:6:0:0]Doors[C:7:0:0] or vertical entries separating each room before you begin.

[C\\:1\\:0\\:0]Burrows[C\\:7\\:0\\:0] ar.string: [C:1:0:0]Burrows[C:7:0:0] are work and living areas where citizens can be assigned.

Workers will try to limit their tasks to.string: Workers will try to limit their tasks to the confines of the [C:1:0:0]Burrow[C:7:0:0], but they will sometimes form paths which pass through other areas.

[C\\:1\\:0\\:0]Burrows[C\\:7\\:0\\:0] ca.string: [C:1:0:0]Burrows[C:7:0:0] can be suspended and unsuspended freely.  When a [C:1:0:0]Burrow[C:7:0:0] is suspended, assigned citizens will ignore it.

It can be useful to assign all of your c.string: It can be useful to assign all of your civilians to a safe emergency [C:1:0:0]Burrow[C:7:0:0] which you activate in case of intruders.

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Minecarts[C\\:7\\:0\\:0].string: [C:6:0:1]Minecarts[C:7:0:0] and [C:6:0:0]Tracks[C:7:0:0] are a convenient way to move a lot of objects around the fortress quickly, though they take a little effort to prepare.

One [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Minecart[C\\:7\\:0\\:.string: One [C:6:0:1]Minecart[C:7:0:0] can be assigned to each route, and workers will move the vehicle from [C:6:0:0]Track Stop[C:7:0:0] to [C:6:0:0]Track Stop[C:7:0:0] according to conditions you specify.

Each [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Track Stop[C\\:7\\:0.string: Each [C:6:0:0]Track Stop[C:7:0:0] must be linked to a [C:6:0:0]Stockpile[C:7:0:0] for [C:6:0:1]Items[C:7:0:0] to be put on or removed from the [C:6:0:1]Minecart[C:7:0:0].

Only one condition needs to be satisfied.string: Only one condition needs to be satisfied for the [C:6:0:1]Minecart[C:7:0:0] to move to the next [C:6:0:0]Track Stop[C:7:0:0].

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Minecarts[C\\:7\\:0\\:0].string: [C:6:0:1]Minecarts[C:7:0:0] that move too quickly around corners will spill their contents.

When a route has a steep descent, consid.string: When a route has a steep descent, consider using powered [C:6:0:0]Rollers[C:7:0:0], extra curves, track "stops" between [C:6:0:0]Stops[C:7:0:0] with various friction settings, or a worker to guide the vehicle.

Here you can see every [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]It.string: Here you can see every [C:6:0:1]Item[C:7:0:0] in the fortress.

Click on category headings to collapse a.string: Click on category headings to collapse and expand them.

If you don't have a [C\\:5\\:0\\:0]Bookk.string: If you don't have a [C:5:0:0]Bookkeeper[C:7:0:0], or they don't have an [C:3:0:0]Office[C:7:0:0] to work in, numbers may be approximate.

Work details are one way you can control.string: Work details are one way you can control which workers do which tasks, and they are the only way to assign certain tasks like mining, woodcutting, hunting, and fishing.

Generally, almost every task will be ava.string: Generally, almost every task will be available for every citizen, but you can both restrict both citizens and tasks.

Citizens are restricted by using their [.string: Citizens are restricted by using their [C:5:0:1]Specialization[C:7:0:0] button.

Tasks are restricted by setting their wo.string: Tasks are restricted by setting their work detail to [C:5:0:1]"Only selected do this"[C:7:0:0].

If a task does not have a default work d.string: If a task does not have a default work detail, you can create a custom work detail.  Once you assign citizens to the task, you can then set [C:5:0:1]"Only selected do this"[C:7:0:0] if you want to restrict it.

Here you can view your nobles, as well a.string: Here you can view your nobles, as well as assign your administrators, military leaders, and other officials.

Once the first leader is assigned, subse.string: Once the first leader is assigned, subsequent [C:5:0:0]Captain[C:7:0:0] positions will appear.

These can also be assigned from the squa.string: These can also be assigned from the squad menu.

Certain important functions in your fort.string: Certain important functions in your fortress can only be performed by assigned administrators, such as the [C:5:0:0]Manager[C:7:0:0] and [C:5:0:0]Bookkeeper[C:7:0:0].

Once they are assigned, you can create w.string: Once they are assigned, you can create work orders, run a [C:1:0:1]Hospital[C:7:0:0], and count and appraise your hoard.

Nobles and certain administrators requir.string: Nobles and certain administrators require rooms, and some may also make demands.

If you have a law enforcement administra.string: If you have a law enforcement administrator like a [C:5:0:0]Sheriff[C:7:0:0] or [C:5:0:0]Captain of the Guard[C:7:0:0], witnesses of crimes will make reports, which find their way here.

Certain crimes are indicative of larger.string: Certain crimes are indicative of larger problems, so you should pay attention to them, and affected victims and family members get upset if crime is ignored.

It's up to you to choose whom to convict.string: It's up to you to choose whom to convict.

All available witness information is pre.string: All available witness information is presented for each case.

This is particularly important for schem.string: This is particularly important for schemes where the witnesses might not have the full story.

It is recommended to place a certain num.string: It is recommended to place a certain number of [C:6:0:0]Cages[C:7:0:0] and [C:6:0:0]Chains[C:7:0:0] and assign them to a [C:3:0:0]Dungeon[C:7:0:0] zone.

Officers may opt for physical punishment.string: Officers may opt for physical punishment if they cannot carry out custodial sentences.

Here you can create squads, fill their p.string: Here you can create squads, fill their positions, assign equipment and schedules, and give specific orders.

Although this location is relatively saf.string: Although this location is relatively safe, it is recommended that you prepare a squad and get them training at some point.

Wildlife and even your own citizens can.string: Wildlife and even your own citizens can still be dangerous at times.

It is recommended that you prepare a squ.string: It is recommended that you prepare a squad and get them training as soon as you can.

You have no idea what's lurking out ther.string: You have no idea what's lurking out there.

The world created at the beginning of th.string: The world created at the beginning of the game is active, and others may take an interest in your outpost as it grows.

Stolen [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Artifacts[C\\:7\\:.string: Stolen [C:6:0:1]Artifacts[C:7:0:0] and kidnapped citizens can be recovered by preparing missions from this screen.

You can also cause trouble if you'd like.string: You can also cause trouble if you'd like to raid your neighbors.

Raids are created by clicking on any sit.string: Raids are created by clicking on any site not belonging to your civilization.

Work orders are used to automate [C\\:3\.string: Work orders are used to automate [C:3:0:1]Tasks[C:7:0:0] in [C:6:0:0]Workshops[C:7:0:0].

These work orders are set to complete a.string: These work orders are set to complete a certain number of [C:3:0:1]Tasks[C:7:0:0] and can be given start conditions.

For instance, you can create an order to.string: For instance, you can create an order to [C:3:0:1]Make Wooden Bins[C:7:0:0] if you are out of empty ones, to [C:3:0:1]Brew Drinks[C:7:0:0] if you are running low, or to [C:3:0:1]Make Five Statues[C:7:0:0] every month.

You can limit work orders to a number of.string: You can limit work orders to a number of [C:6:0:0]Workshops[C:7:0:0].

You can also create work orders at speci.string: You can also create work orders at specific [C:6:0:0]Workshops[C:7:0:0] from their building sheet.

The system is reasonably powerful and yo.string: The system is reasonably powerful and you can eventually automate almost all of your production if you wish.

If you find that your stockpiles are fil.string: If you find that your stockpiles are filling up too fast, you can create room by building [C:6:0:1]Bins[C:7:0:0],

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Barrels[C\\:7\\:0\\:0], a.string: [C:6:0:1]Barrels[C:7:0:0], and [C:6:0:1]Bags[C:7:0:0].  [C:6:0:1]Barrels[C:7:0:0] are used to store [C:6:0:1]Food[C:7:0:0].  [C:6:0:1]Bags[C:7:0:0] are used to store [C:6:0:1]Seeds[C:7:0:0]

(and some other things like [C\\:6\\:0\\.string: (and some other things like [C:6:0:1]Sand[C:7:0:0]).  [C:6:0:1]Bins[C:7:0:0] hold just about everything else except [C:6:0:1]Furniture[C:7:0:0], [C:6:0:1]Wood[C:7:0:0] and [C:6:0:1]Boulders[C:7:0:0].

The [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Carpenter's Workshop[.string: The [C:6:0:0]Carpenter's Workshop[C:7:0:0] is the best place to make lightweight [C:6:0:1]Bins[C:7:0:0] and [C:6:0:1]Barrels[C:7:0:0], but they can also be made at

the [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Stoneworker's Shop[C\.string: the [C:6:0:0]Stoneworker's Shop[C:7:0:0] and the [C:6:0:0]Metalsmith's Forge[C:7:0:0].  [C:6:0:1]Bags[C:7:0:0] are created at the [C:6:0:0]Clothier's Shop[C:7:0:0] or the [C:6:0:0]Leatherworks[C:7:0:0].

When the caravan arrives at the [C\\:6\\.string: When the caravan arrives at the [C:6:0:0]Trade Depot[C:7:0:0], you must click on the depot and select [C:5:0:1]"Bring Goods to Depot"[C:7:0:0].

Here you can select which goods you wish.string: Here you can select which goods you wish to trade.  After everyone has brought their goods you can

select [C\\:5\\:0\\:1]\"Trade\"[C\\:7\\:.string: select [C:5:0:1]"Trade"[C:7:0:0].  Don't worry if you have no [C:5:0:0]Broker[C:7:0:0], just select [C:5:0:1]"Anyone can Trade"[C:7:0:0].  You cannot trade

until your [C\\:5\\:0\\:0]Broker[C\\:7\\.string: until your [C:5:0:0]Broker[C:7:0:0] or another resident arrives at the depot.

When trading you select which goods you.string: When trading you select which goods you want from the list on the left, and which goods of yours to

trade from the list on the right. Then.string: trade from the list on the right.  Then hit [C:5:0:1]"Trade"[C:7:0:0].  The trader will accept if the deal is fair and

they can carry away the weight of the th.string: they can carry away the weight of the things you are selling.

Note that if you have a [C\\:5\\:0\\:0]B.string: Note that if you have a [C:5:0:0]Broker[C:7:0:0] the value of each good with be shown if their skill is high enough.

In order for some functions to be used,.string: In order for some functions to be used, like work orders or bookkeeping, [C:5:0:0]Administrators[C:7:0:0] must be assigned.

To do this select the [C\\:5\\:0\\:1]Nob.string: To do this select the [C:5:0:1]Nobles and administrators[C:7:0:0] menu and click the add button to assign somebody.

Some [C\\:5\\:0\\:0]Administrators[C\\:7.string: Some [C:5:0:0]Administrators[C:7:0:0] will require [C:3:0:0]Offices[C:7:0:0] to perform their work.

The [C\\:3\\:0\\:0]Zone[C\\:7\\:0\\:0] y.string: The [C:3:0:0]Zone[C:7:0:0] you select must contain a [C:6:0:0]Chair[C:7:0:0], or you can paint a [C:3:0:0]Zone[C:7:0:0] and place a [C:6:0:0]Chair[C:7:0:0] later.

Remember to assign the [C\\:5\\:0\\:0]Ad.string: Remember to assign the [C:5:0:0]Administrator[C:7:0:0] to the [C:3:0:0]Office[C:7:0:0].

Other nobles may appear or be assigned a.string: Other nobles may appear or be assigned as

the game progresses. Use the [C\\:5\\:0.string: the game progresses.  Use the [C:5:0:1]Nobles and administrators[C:7:0:0] menu to check their wants and needs.

In order to make [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Metal Ba.string: In order to make [C:6:0:1]Metal Bars[C:7:0:0] for the [C:2:0:0]Metalsmith[C:7:0:0], you must smelt [C:6:0:1]Ore[C:7:0:0].

This can done at the [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Smel.string: This can done at the [C:6:0:0]Smelter[C:7:0:0] which can be found under [C:5:0:1]Workshops[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Furnaces[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Smelter[C:7:0:0].

[C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Ore[C\\:7\\:0\\:0] is min.string: [C:6:0:1]Ore[C:7:0:0] is mined underground, below the soil layers.

If you have found magma you can build a.string: If you have found magma you can build a [C:6:0:0]Magma Smelter[C:7:0:0] directly over it, otherwise you need [C:6:0:1]Fuel[C:7:0:0].

To get [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Fuel[C\\:7\\:0\\:0.string: To get [C:6:0:1]Fuel[C:7:0:0] you need to make [C:6:0:1]Charcoal[C:7:0:0] with a [C:6:0:0]Wood Furnace[C:7:0:0],

You may switch to other forms of [C\\:6\.string: You may switch to other forms of [C:6:0:1]Fuel[C:7:0:0] later, such as [C:6:0:1]Coal[C:7:0:0], but you will usually

need [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Charcoal[C\\:7\\:0\\.string: need [C:6:0:1]Charcoal[C:7:0:0] from the [C:6:0:0]Wood Furnace[C:7:0:0] to start the process.

It is a dangerous world, and if the entr.string: It is a dangerous world, and if the entrances of your fortress are left open,

The best way to avoid this fate is to bu.string: The best way to avoid this fate is to build traps and

lock the ways into your fortress. The w.string: lock the ways into your fortress.  The ways to build traps are as wild as your imagination.

Most require [C\\:6\\:0\\:1]Mechanisms[C.string: Most require [C:6:0:1]Mechanisms[C:7:0:0] made at the [C:6:0:0]Mechanic's Shop[C:7:0:0], using [C:5:0:1]Workshops[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Mechanic[C:7:0:0].

To stop some enemies from entering your.string: To stop some enemies from entering your fortress use [C:5:0:1]Build[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Machines/fluids[C:7:0:0] -> [C:5:0:1]Lever[C:7:0:0] to build a [C:6:0:0]Lever[C:7:0:0].

Then click on the [C\\:6\\:0\\:0]Lever[C.string: Then click on the [C:6:0:0]Lever[C:7:0:0] and choose to link it to a [C:6:0:0]Bridge[C:7:0:0] or [C:6:0:0]Door[C:7:0:0].  This will lock the [C:6:0:0]Door[C:7:0:0]

Your citizens will drink at a water sour.string: Your citizens will drink at a water source zone or gather water using buckets for various tasks.  This is useful if you don't have a functioning well and you want to control exactly where the tasks take place.

Citizens assigned to the fishing work de.string: Citizens assigned to the fishing work detail will fish in this zone if it exists.  Otherwise, they will fish everywhere.

Plant gathering zones are used in locati.string: Plant gathering zones are used in locations where plants will be gathered frequently.  Use the gather designation otherwise.

Items designated for dumping will be tos.string: Items designated for dumping will be tossed into open air spaces included in this zone.  If no open air tiles are included, they will dump the items on the floor.

Certain livestock need to graze on grass.string: Certain livestock need to graze on grass.  Assign these animals to a pasture zone.  No fencing is needed.

Animals assigned to pit/pond zones are d.string: Animals assigned to pit/pond zones are dumped in the pit, but will leave the zone afterward if possible.  If the pit is designated as a pond, your citizens will attempt to fill it with water using buckets.

Your citizens will fill sand bags at thi.string: Your citizens will fill sand bags at this zone if a sandy floor or sandy wall is included.  This task is initiated manually at the glass furnace.

Your citizens will collect clay at this.string: Your citizens will collect clay at this zone if a clay floor or clay wall is included.  This task is initiated manually at the kiln.

This important zone is where your citize.string: This important zone is where your citizens will gather to socialize.  Crucially, the meeting area is where locations such as taverns, temples, hospitals, and the like are established.

Animals that are capable of being traine.string: Animals that are capable of being trained receive their training at this zone once they have been assigned a trainer from the Pets/Livestock menu.  Generally, a piece of meat is required.

Your citizens will sleep in bedrooms. I.string: Your citizens will sleep in bedrooms.  It should include a bed!  Try to enclose it with walls and/or doors.  Do not overlap with other rooms.

Your citizens will eat at this zone. Wh.string: Your citizens will eat at this zone.  When not assigned to a particular citizen, citizens without their own dining hall will eat here.  Tables and adjacent chairs should be included.

An office or study is required for certa.string: An office or study is required for certain official tasks, such as approving work orders and bookkeeping.  A chair or throne is required for these functions.

Your archers can train in this zone if t.string: Your archers can train in this zone if there is an archery target included.

Create a new work order for this worksho.string: Create a new work order for this workshop.  Work orders are tasks that can repeat specified numbers of times and which can be given start conditions.  This is useful for automation.

Add stockpile links for this workshop..string: Add stockpile links for this workshop.

This item is a permanent part of the bui.string: This item is a permanent part of the building.  Forbid and visibility tags set here affect the whole building.

This is a small creature within the trap.string: This is a small creature within the trap.

This item is a semi-permanent part of th.string: This item is a semi-permanent part of the building, like an item on display.

Toggle the forbidden status of the item..string: Toggle the forbidden status of the item.  Citizens will not use forbidden items or buildings.  If a permanent building item is forbidden, citizens will not perform tasks there!

Toggle the visibility of the item. Hidd.string: Toggle the visibility of the item.  Hidden items cannot be seen but citizens will still use them.  If a permanent building item is invisible, the building will be too!

The soldiers can either keep their equip.string: The soldiers can either keep their equipment on at all times, or only when an order is active.

The soldiers can be allowed to sleep in.string: The soldiers can be allowed to sleep in their rooms whenever they way, or in the barracks either when they want or only when they must.

The squad leader is traveling or otherwi.string: The squad leader is traveling or otherwise occupied off-site.

View the positions in this squad..string: View the positions in this squad.

Assign a station order. The soldiers wi.string: Assign a station order.  The soldiers will stand near the point selected and engage any hostile creatures that come near.

Assign a kill order. The soldiers will.string: Assign a kill order.  The soldiers will attempt to kill a targeted creature.

Assign a patrol order. The soldiers wil.string: Assign a patrol order.  The soldiers will walk a specified route repeatedly.

Assign a burrow defense order. The sold.string: Assign a burrow defense order.  The soldiers will patrol the burrow and attack any hostile creatures.

Assign a training order. The squad must.string: Assign a training order.  The squad must be assigned to a barracks zone with the training option set.

Cancel an order. Does not affect schedu.string: Cancel an order.  Does not affect scheduled orders.

Toggle whether the squad will store squa.string: Toggle whether the squad will store squad-level equipment here, such as ammunition.

Show up and down arrows over ramps at th.string: Show up and down arrows over ramps at the current elevation.

Zoom in on the play area..string: Zoom in on the play area.

Zoom out from the play area..string: Zoom out from the play area.

Open the stocks window, where you can se.string: Open the stocks window, where you can see all of your fortress's items.

Most tasks in the fortress are started a.string: Most tasks in the fortress are started and completed at workshops.  Tasks generally require raw materials and most workshops are constructed from boulders, blocks, or wood.

Furnaces are used for smelting, glassmak.string: Furnaces are used for smelting, glassmaking, pottery, ashmaking, or to make fuel from wood or raw coal.  Furnaces require fuel to function, or they can be set above magma.

These workshops are used in the clothesm.string: These workshops are used in the clothesmaking process, whether dyeing and weaving or using tanned hides.

A wide variety of food-and-drink-related.string: A wide variety of food-and-drink-related workshops can be found in this category.

Use options in this category to place fu.string: Use options in this category to place furniture that has already been constructed in a workshop.

Place doors and hatches here after you h.string: Place doors and hatches here after you have constructed them in an appropriate workshop.

Most terrain-altering constructions can.string: Most terrain-altering constructions can be found here, from walls and floors to bridges, ramps, stairs, and more.

More complicated buildings from wells to.string: More complicated buildings from wells to powered machine components to levers and floodgates are found here.

Cages, ropes, and animal traps are found.string: Cages, ropes, and animal traps are found here.  Cages can be used in cage traps or to transport large animals.  Metal cages and chains are also used by the justice system.

Various mechanical traps can be found he.string: Various mechanical traps can be found here.  The pressure plate is also found here, which has applications beyond traps.

Archery targets, siege weapons, and some.string: Archery targets, siege weapons, and some ornamental display items can be found in this category.

This crucial building is where all tradi.string: This crucial building is where all trading will be done.  Pack animals from distant civilizations will need to access this building from the edge of the map.  Later, wagons will need a clear 3-wide path to the depot.

Used to make lye, potash, and milk of li.string: Used to make lye, potash, and milk of lime.  Construction requires blocks, barrel, and a bucket.

Make crossbows here from wood or bone..string: Make crossbows here from wood or bone.  The metalsmith's forge can be used for metal crossbows and metal bolts, and the crafts workshop is used to make other bolts.

Make beds and various furniture here, as.string: Make beds and various furniture here, as well as bins, barrels, and more.

Make crafts for trade and your own citiz.string: Make crafts for trade and your own citizens here, as well as a variety of tools, armor, and bolts.

Cut rough gems here to increase their va.string: Cut rough gems here to increase their value, and improve the value of other objects by encrusting them with cut gems.

Forge weapons and armor here, as well as.string: Forge weapons and armor here, as well as most other metal objects from furniture to trap components.  Magma below the forge will power tasks.  You are responsible for placing the forge above the magma, but no other fuel is required.

Make mechanisms here which are used to m.string: Make mechanisms here which are used to make levers, pressure plates, and gears.  You can also use mechanisms to link levers and pressure plates to other machinery.

Forge weapons and armor here, as well as.string: Forge weapons and armor here, as well as most other metal objects from furniture to trap components.  These tasks require fuel.

Here you can make parts for ballistae an.string: Here you can make parts for ballistae and catapults.  This workshop is also the place where ballista ammo is assembled.

Make stone furniture here, as well as bl.string: Make stone furniture here, as well as blocks which are used in constructions.

Use leather tanned at the tanner's shop.string: Use leather tanned at the tanner's shop here to make clothing and tools, such as bags and waterskins.

Here you can turn thread into cloth, whe.string: Here you can turn thread into cloth, whether it is thread from the farmer's workshop or spider silk gathered underground.

Make cloth into clothing and tools here,.string: Make cloth into clothing and tools here, such as bags and ropes.

Use dyes here to color thread and cloth..string: Use dyes here to color thread and cloth.  Requires a barrel and bucket for construction.

Brew alcohol from plants, fruit, or hone.string: Brew alcohol from plants, fruit, or honey.

Slaughter livestock here in order to obt.string: Slaughter livestock here in order to obtain meat, hides, bones, and other animal products.

Make leather from animal hides here. Yo.string: Make leather from animal hides here.  You can also make parchment using milk of lime and a hide.

Process raw fish into edible food here..string: Process raw fish into edible food here.  Raw fish will not be eaten.

Cook meals here. You can also render fa.string: Cook meals here.  You can also render fat into tallow.

Process plants and work with livestock h.string: Process plants and work with livestock here.  Milk and shear animals, make cheese, and spin thread.

Make sugar, flour, and various useful sl.string: Make sugar, flour, and various useful slurries here.  Tasks are completed very slowly compared to the powered millstone.

Capture and train small animals here. R.string: Capture and train small animals here.  Requires animal traps.

Make sugar, flour, and various useful sl.string: Make sugar, flour, and various useful slurries here.  Powered version of the quern.  Must be hooked to a windmill or water wheel to function.

You can make a variety of objects using.string: You can make a variety of objects using three different types of glass.  You can also collect sand in bags from a task originating here, if you have a sand collection zone.  Glassmaking requires fuel.

Bake clay objects here, as well as a few.string: Bake clay objects here, as well as a few other useful materials.  Clay can also be collected here if you have a clay collection zone.  All tasks require fuel aside from clay collection.

You can make a variety of objects using.string: You can make a variety of objects using three different types of glass.  You can also collect sand in bags from a task originating here, if you have a sand collection zone.  Magma below the furnace will power tasks.  You are responsible for placing the furnace above the magma, but no other fuel is required.

Bake clay objects here, as well as a few.string: Bake clay objects here, as well as a few other useful materials.  Clay can also be collected here if you have a clay collection zone.  Magma below the kiln will power tasks.  You are responsible for placing the kiln above the magma, but no other fuel is required.

Make metal bars from ore here. Can also.string: Make metal bars from ore here.  Can also refine coal into usable fuel or make alloys.  Magma below the smelter will power tasks.  You are responsible for placing the smelter above the magma, but no other fuel is required.
Make metal bars from ore here.  Can also refine coal into usable fuel or make alloys.  All tasks require fuel.

Make charcoal and ash from wood here. D.string: Make charcoal and ash from wood here.  Does not require fuel.

Plant crops at the farmplot. You will n.string: Plant crops at the farmplot.  You will need seeds or spawn and must select crops by season.  Crops can be fertilized with potash.  Soil is richer deeper underground.

When placed, a female bird will claim th.string: When placed, a female bird will claim the box and start laying eggs, if one is available.

Keep a colony of insects at your hives..string: Keep a colony of insects at your hives.  A wild colony must be collected after the hive is placed, or a colony can be split from an existing hive colony.

Your citizens need a comfortable place t.string: Your citizens need a comfortable place to sleep.  A bed object must be made at the carpenter's shop before it can be placed.

Chairs are required for offices to funct.string: Chairs are required for offices to function, and a chair next to a table is the preferred dining arrangement.  A chair/throne object must be made before it can be placed.

Tables are required for dining. A chair.string: Tables are required for dining.  A chair should be placed adjacent to the table.  A table object must be made before it can be placed.

Chests and coffers are used in personal.string: Chests and coffers are used in personal bedrooms for storing non-clothing objects.  They are also used in some zone-based locations like taverns, hospitals, and libraries for storing useful materials.  A box object must be made before it can be placed.

Cabinets are used in personal bedrooms f.string: Cabinets are used in personal bedrooms for storing clothing objects.  A cabinet object must be made before it can be placed.

The dead are buried in coffins. Coffins.string: The dead are buried in coffins.  Coffins must be placed in their own tomb zone in order to work.  A coffin object must be made before it can be placed.

Citizens that cannot be buried properly.string: Citizens that cannot be buried properly can still be memorialized on slabs.  Slabs are created and engraved at the stoneworker's shop.

Statues can be used to decorate your for.string: Statues can be used to decorate your fortress and add value to your rooms.  A statue object must be made at an appropriate workshop first.

Certain injuries such as overlapping fra.string: Certain injuries such as overlapping fractures require advanced medical contraptions like the traction bench for treatment.  A traction bench object must be made before it can be placed.

Codices and scrolls in your library can.string: Codices and scrolls in your library can be stored in bookcases.  A bookcase object must be made before it can be placed.

Your most valuable objects can be placed.string: Your most valuable objects can be placed for display in rooms to increase their value and to entertain passing citizens.  A pedestal or display case must be made before it can be placed.

These ornamental objects increase the va.string: These ornamental objects increase the value of rooms in which they are placed.  An offering place object must be made before it can be placed.

Large instruments must be placed in tave.string: Large instruments must be placed in taverns or temples before they will be used.  These instruments must be assembled at a workshop first.

Doors can be used along with walls to en.string: Doors can be used along with walls to enclose rooms, which is especially important when placing multiple zones at once.  Doors can also be forbidden or attached to levers to control movement in the fort.

Hatches can be placed at the tops of sta.string: Hatches can be placed at the tops of stairwells or above ramps to control movement in the fort when they are forbidden or attached to levers.

Bridges can be used to span open spaces.string: Bridges can be used to span open spaces or placed above water or magma.  Bridges can be connected to levers and raised to block access.

Dirt roads do not require materials, but.string: Dirt roads do not require materials, but the dirt road may quickly be overgrown by plants.

Blocks creatures but allows the passage.string: Blocks creatures but allows the passage of fluids and items.  Can be built on any floor.  Grates unlike bars have a quality and enhance the value of rooms.  Grates can be connected to levers.

Blocks creatures but allows the passage of fluids and items.  Can be built over empty spaces, stairs, ramps, or above liquids.  Grates unlike bars have a quality and enhance the value of rooms.  Grates can be connected to levers.

Blocks creatures but allows the passage of fluids and items.  Can be built on any floor.  Bars unlike grates do not have a quality and so do not enhance the value of rooms significantly.  Bars can be connected to levers.

Blocks creatures but allows the passage of fluids and items.  Can be built over empty spaces, stairs, ramps, or above liquids.  Bars unlike grates do not have a quality and so do not enhance the value of rooms significantly.  Bars can be connected to levers.

This ornamental construction can enhance.string: This ornamental construction can enhance the value of rooms.  A window object must be made at a glass furnace before it can be placed.
This ornamental construction can enhance the value of rooms.  Three cut gem objects must be made at a jeweler's shop before it can be placed.

Supports will stop cave-ins in the rare.string: Supports will stop cave-ins in the rare event you completely detach a piece of your fortress.  Otherwise, they are ornamental.

You can build walls aboveground, in cave.string: You can build walls aboveground, in caverns, or in spaces you have mined out in order to block the passage of creatures, objects, and fluids.  Requires boulder, block, or wood.

You can place floors for functional reas.string: You can place floors for functional reasons or to enhance the appearance of the fortress.  Requires boulder, block, or wood.

You can build a ramp next to a wall to p.string: You can build a ramp next to a wall to provide access to the floor above.  The space above the ramp must also be empty.  Requires boulder, block, or wood.

You can build staircases to connect diff.string: You can build staircases to connect different elevations.  Staircases must span at least two elevations.  Requires boulder, block, or wood.

Fortifications block creature movement b.string: Fortifications block creature movement but allow projectiles through.  Soldiers near fortifications are reasonably safe from incoming projectiles.  Requires boulder, block, or wood.

Use minecart tracks in conjunction with.string: Use minecart tracks in conjunction with the hauling menu.

Place the well in an open space above wa.string: Place the well in an open space above water to provide a relatively safe area for your citizens to draw water.  Requires mechanisms, blocks, a chain or rope, and a bucket.

Use floodgates to control the flow of fl.string: Use floodgates to control the flow of fluids between spaces in your fortress.  Must be attached to a lever or pressure plate to function.  Requires a floodgate object to be built before it can be placed.

Use a screw pump to move liquids upward.string: Use a screw pump to move liquids upward from the elevation below the pump to the same elevation as the pump.

Place the water wheel above flowing wate.string: Place the water wheel above flowing water to generate power for machines, such as the millstone or screw pump.

Place the windmill aboveground to genera.string: Place the windmill aboveground to generate power for machines, such as the millstone or screw pump.  Not all areas have strong winds.

Use the gear assembly to connect axles a.string: Use the gear assembly to connect axles and machinery together.  Gear assemblies can be disengaged temporarily by linking them to levers.

Horizontal axles transfer power on the s.string: Horizontal axles transfer power on the same elevation.  Horizontal axles can be east-west or north-south.

Vertical axles transfer power between tw.string: Vertical axles transfer power between two adjacent elevations.

Rollers move minecarts on tracks without.string: Rollers move minecarts on tracks without the need for a citizen to push or guide the minecart.

A chain can be placed for use in the jus.string: A chain can be placed for use in the justice system or for the restraint of an animal.

Cages can be used to contain an animal,.string: Cages can be used to contain an animal, and metal cages can be used by the justice system.  Glass cages can be filled with water and used as aquariums.

Animal traps can be placed in the wild a.string: Animal traps can be placed in the wild and baited with meat, plants, or gems, in order to catch small creatures.

Track stops are used in conjunction with.string: Track stops are used in conjunction with the hauling menu.  They can also be used to add friction to minecart tracks.

Levers are used with machines, doors, fl.string: Levers are used with machines, doors, floodgates, bridges, cages, and other structures to change their state.

Pressure plates, like levers, are used w.string: Pressure plates, like levers, are used with machines, doors, floodgates, bridges, cages, and other structures to change their state.  The trigger for pressure plates can be set by creature weight, fluid, or minecart passage.

Stone-fall traps drop a stone on intrude.string: Stone-fall traps drop a stone on intruders.  Must be loaded with boulders.

Weapon traps use a weapon or trap compon.string: Weapon traps use a weapon or trap component to strike intruders.  Can be used with ranged weapons and loaded with ammo.  Can use multiple weapons at once.

Cage traps capture intruders in cages..string: Cage traps capture intruders in cages.  Must be loaded with a cage.

Upright weapons are a nasty place for in.string: Upright weapons are a nasty place for intruders to fall upon.  Can also be linked to levers or pressure plates to raise them into intruders.

Archery targets are used in archery rang.string: Archery targets are used in archery range zones for training archers.

A ballista fires a ballista arrow in one.string: A ballista fires a ballista arrow in one of the four cardinal directions.  The operator can adjust the aim slightly.

A catapult fires a boulder in one of the.string: A catapult fires a boulder in one of the four cardinal directions.  The operator can adjust the aim slightly.

Create a creature to place in the arena..string: Create a creature to place in the arena.

Remove fluids and spatter from the arena.string: Remove fluids and spatter from the arena.

Create a tree to place in the arena..string: Create a tree to place in the arena.

Change the weather, temperature, and tim.string: Change the weather, temperature, and time.

You can recenter on certain announcement.string: You can recenter on certain announcements.  Right click to close.

Select a report to view the full text..string: Select a report to view the full text.  Right click to close.

Make requests for next year's caravan..string: Make requests for next year's caravan.  They'll charge more for these items.

We will gladly do as you ask and strengt.string: We will gladly do as you ask and strengthen our bonds of friendship.

Sadly, we do not possess this object. B.string: Sadly, we do not possess this object.  Best of luck in your search.

Give up this childish errand. We do not.string: Give up this childish errand.  We do not part with our treasures lightly.

Your claim is worthless here. Trade you.string: Your claim is worthless here.  Trade your lives if you must.

I hear the call. Let us stop this war..string: I hear the call.  Let us stop this war.

We will drown out the call with the scre.string: We will drown out the call with the screams of your dying.  Begone.

I can scarcely believe this good news!.string: I can scarcely believe this good news!  I have some recommendations.

Flattering, but we'd rather maintain our.string: Flattering, but we'd rather maintain our distance from the homeland.

We can abide by this. Let us work towar.string: We can abide by this.  Let us work toward mutual co-existence.

Our needs exceed your allowances. Relax.string: Our needs exceed your allowances.  Relax.  They're only trees.

We can grant this request. Let's discus.string: We can grant this request.  Let's discuss the specifics, though...

We cannot stop production just because o.string: We cannot stop production just because of your quaint sensibilities.

You do not have an official capable of h.string: You do not have an official capable of handling these matters.

There are no petitions that need your at.string: There are no petitions that need your attention.

a temple complex and high priest.string: a temple complex and high priest

The location must be built and furnished.string: The location must be built and furnished,

[C\\:VAR\\:MEETING\\:ACTOR][VAR\\:NATIVE.string: [C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Farewell, [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:NOBLE].  I look forward to our meeting next year.  Our fortunes rise and fall together.
[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  I am your liaison from the Mountainhomes.  Let's discuss your situation.

[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  You have disrespected the trees in this area, but this is what we have come to expect from your stunted kind.  Further abuse cannot be tolerated.  Let this be a warning to you.

[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  What a pleasant surprise!  Not a single tree here weeps from the abuses meted out with such ease by your people.  Joy!  The dwarves have turned a page, not that we would make paper.  A travesty!  Perhaps it is better said that the dwarves have turned over a new leaf, and the springtime for our two races has only just begun.
[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Although we do not always see eye to eye (ha!), I bid you farewell.  May you someday embrace nature as you embrace the rocks and mud.
[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Greetings from the woodlands.  We have much to discuss.
[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  It has been an honor, noble [VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:NOBLE].  I bid you farewell.
[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Greetings, noble dwarf.  There is much to discuss.
[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  Again on behalf of the Merchants' Guild, let me bid farewell to you and your stout dwarves.
[C:VAR:MEETING:ACTOR][VAR:NATIVENAME:MEETING:ACTOR]:  On behalf of the Merchants' Guild, let me extend greetings to your people.  There is much to discuss.

[B]The rhythm system is fundamentally po.string: [B]The rhythm system is fundamentally polyrhythmic.  There are always multiple rhythm lines, and each of their bars is played over the same period of time, regardless of the number of beats.  The rhythm lines are thought of as one, without a primary-subordinate relationship, though individual lines can be named.

[B]The rhythm system is fundamentally polymetric.  There are always multiple rhythm lines, and the beats are always played together, even if one rhythm line completes (and then repeats) before the other is finished.  The rhythm lines are thought of as one, without a primary-subordinate relationship, though individual lines can be named.
